Message.Title: Quotidian trading quirks vs growth investing
Message.Msg: They, the fundamentals-investors are and will be coming aboard, slowly but surely (so will the mo players n swing traders). Doesn’t hurt to take another cursory once-over of NVDA’s FYQ2: double-digit sequential growths in all 3 key areas 1) overall rev up 13%, 2) Keplar chip sales up 15% 3) Tegra chips up 36%. “International Data Corporation in an update of the Semiconductor Applications Forecaster (SAF) forecasts that worldwide semiconductor revenues will increase 4.6 percent in 2012 to $315 billion.” If NVDA can keep at a growth rate of about 15-16% this year -- a plausible objective, has another major client sign-up i.e., Lenovo on 8/13/12 -- it would stand ready to fulfill its earlier forecast of 4.7 to $5 billion in sales (a forecast that was retracted in February). NVDA would be recognized as a GROWTH stock as such and thus be reflected in its share price accordingly. This recognition would happen sooner than later, IMHO. For the chartist, the 12-month graph movement tells a compelling history particularly since the last Feb drop. Here’s the link: http://finance.yahoo.com/echarts?s=NVDA+Interactive#symbol=nvda;range=1y;compare=;indicator=volume;charttype=area;crosshair=on;ohlcvalues=0;logscale=off;source=undefined GLTA P.S. I maintain my call of 16.5 for the high for this Q with most of the trading in the 15-16 range.

Message.Title: nVidia’s GTX 660 Ti is out still can’t beat AMD’s HD 7950 for the same price.
Message.Msg: LOL. AMD’s HD 7950 beating GTX 660 Ti at the same price point. Crysis Warhead: 2560 x 1600 HD 7950B: 32.2 FPS GTX 660 Ti: 25 FPS http://www.anandtech.com/show/6159/the-geforce-gtx-660-ti-review/7 Metro 2033: 2560 x 1600 HD 7950B: 34.5 FPS GTX 660 Ti: 32 FPS http://www.anandtech.com/show/6159/the-geforce-gtx-660-ti-review/8 The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim: 2560 x 1600 HD 7950B: 86 GTX 660Ti : 75.9 http://www.anandtech.com/show/6159/the-geforce-gtx-660-ti-review/14 GTX 660 Ti: $319.0 http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814125440 AMD’s HD 7950: $319.0 http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814150590 So for the same price you get a faster product. What’s more astonishing is that AMD is able to beat GTX 670 a $400 GPU in certain benches like Skyrim, Crysis Warhead, and Metro 2033. Was expecting more from nVidia.

Topic.Title: nVidia’s GTX 660 Ti is out still can’t beat AMD’s HD 7950 for the same price.

Message.Msg: Cherry pick benchmarks? No I don't think you know how to read or know anything about GPU's. Metro 2033 and Crysis are the two most demanding games. Did you know that didn't think so. Which means any future demanding games AMD will run better. LOL. Straight from the editor's mouth: "If we had to pick something, on a pure performance-per-dollar basis the 7950 looks good both now and in the future; in particular we suspect it’s going to weather newer games better than the GTX 660 Ti and its relatively narrow memory bus. It has a narrow memory bus and is getting beat on now computationally intensive apps like Crysis and Metro 2033. When Metro Last Night comes out and Crysis 3 comes out those games along with other's in the future will require more memory bandwidth. That's why it's more future proof because 660 Ti can't handle computational intensive due to it's very narrow memory bus. Typically clueless. You got owned!

Message.Title: Hey smallstock
Message.Msg: re: Algorithm Other thread got polluted, so starting new one. My beliefs align with your views on this subject and feel NVDA is the posterchild for manipulated stocks. Let me tell you what the HFT shops are about: Millions$ in investment in hardware and software. GPGPU, the SW to run on it, and some very bright and expensive minds to think about the problem and program solutions are a big capital investment to these hedge funds. No one will turn over their formula, it's incredible IP to these guys. (Side note: its sort of amazing that NVDA IR sits idly by and watches while these guys regularly skim all the cream off any gain.) The constant noise we hear from certain IDs are also part of the investment. That said I've watched this stock for a long time. With the setup from Tues and Wed, I would bet tomorrow or Friday will be a down day, under Wed's close for sure. Today was a classic headfake to suck the little guy in, but there was no volume. Volume is key.

Message.Title: Cray to Add NVIDIA to Its Next-Gen Supercomputer
Message.Msg: Cray to Add NVIDIA Kepler GPUs to Its Next-Generation "Cascade" Supercomputer "Cascade will be the first system to combine three key technologies: the latest Intel Xeon CPUs, Cray's next-generation Aries system interconnect, and new Tesla Kepler-based GPUs, the highest performance, most energy-efficient accelerators ever built," said Sumit Gupta, senior director of the Tesla business unit at NVIDIA. "This combination enables applications to scale to tens of thousands of CPU-GPU nodes to solve the world's most complex scientific computing problems." http://investors.cray.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=98390&p=irol-newsArticle&ID=1726178 Hello Best ;)
